section.name: What Is Apache James Mailbox?
section.p: The Apache James Mailbox is a library providing a flexible Mailbox storage accessible by mail protocols (IMAP4, POP3, SMTP,...) and other protocols.
It can also be embedded into your application to implement for example the Mailbox Pattern.
The mailbox library supports different persistence mechanisms: MailDir, SQL Database via Apache OpenJPA and JCR (Java Content Repository) via Apache JackRabbit.
We are also planning to implement distributed persistence such as Hadoop and NoSQL storage systems (see MAILBOX-44 and MAILBOX-45).
You can download current 0.2-M2 milestone. The API as the Database schema are susceptible to evolve (see for example MAILBOX-46).

section.name: Apache James Mailbox in Server and other librairies
section.p: Apache James Server 3 uses this library to implement its user mailboxes. A backport to Apache James Server 2.3.2 would require a volunteer.
The Mailbox is tested and fully compatible with other Apache James libraries such as the Apache James IMAP (see this link for the Mailbox/IMAP tests source code)

section.name: Develop on Apache James Mailbox
section.p: Go to the source code page to get more information on how to develop on James Mailbox.
